Class Bank

  • java.lang.Object
    • Bank

  • public class Bank
extends java.lang.Object
    The purpose of this Class is to display one account separately or all accounts in the Bank at once. Locates Bank Accounts from within the @accounts ArrayList. Performs monthly updates on all Bank Accounts in the @accounts ArrayList. Opens, reads, and closes an input text file. Creates, opens, and closes and output text file.
    Since:
    JDK 1.8
    Version:
    1.3
    Author:
    Patrick Czermak

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Bank()
      Constructor which initializes accounts to a Bank Account in the ArrayList.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bank

        public Bank()
        Constructor which initializes accounts to a Bank Account in the ArrayList.

    • Method Detail

      • displayAccount

        public java.lang.String displayAccount(long accountNumber)
        Method displayAccount displays account information through calling findAccount(accountNumber) method in current class. Checks first to make sure @accounts ArrayList index isn't negative or returns an error message to GUI.
        Parameters:
        accountNumber - a specific account number in the @accounts ArrayList
        Returns:
        either the specified account number if it exists or an error message

      • printAccountDetails

        public void printAccountDetails()
        Method printAccountDetails prints all accounts in @accounts ArrayList to an output text file. Catches securityException, formatterClosedException, and fileNotFoundException when outputting to a text file and pop-up window displays error message. Utilizes the toString() method to ensure proper account information is displayed for each account.

      • findAccount

        public int findAccount(long accountNumber)
        Method static findAccount(int accountNumber) is overloaded which takes input instead of asking for it. Used when adding a new account.
        Parameters:
        accountNumber - a specific account number in the @accounts ArrayList.
        Returns:
        -1 or the index of the account.

      • monthlyUpdate

        public java.lang.String monthlyUpdate()
        Method monthlyUpdate performs an update on all accounts existing in the @accounts ArrayList.
        Returns:
        message monthly updates to all of the accounts in the Bank

      • openInputFile

        public void openInputFile(java.awt.Component parentFrame)
        Method openInputFile opens the text file "bankData.txt". Catches an IO(input/Output) Exception and pop-up error window displays if unable to open the file.
        Parameters:
        parentFrame - Frame used to display pop-up window message dialogs

      • readRecords

        public void readRecords(java.awt.Component parentFrame)
        Method readRecords reads and formats information from the text file bankData.txt, and creates either a new Chequing or Savings Account in the Bank. Catches NoSuchElementException and IllegalStateException when file is not properly formed or an error reading from the file. Each exception prompts a pop-up window to display informing user of error.
        Parameters:
        parentFrame - Frame used to display pop-up window message dialogs

      • closeInputFile

        public void closeInputFile()
        Method closeInputFile closes a text file.

      • openOutputFile

        public void openOutputFile(java.awt.Component parentFrame)
                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Method openOutputFile creates a new text file. Catches SecurityException when write permissions are denied on the file, and prompts a pop-up window to display informing user of error.
        Parameters:
        parentFrame - Frame used to display pop-up window message dialogs
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - throws up to printAccoountDetails() where handled

      • closeOutputFile

        public void closeOutputFile()
        Method closeOutputFile closes the output file that was created. Once completed prompts a pop-up to display confirming successful completion.

      • getAccounts

        public java.util.ArrayList<BankAccount> getAccounts()
        Method gets and stores accounts ArrayList. BankSimulatorFrame Class utilizes this to access the ArrayList.
        Returns:
        accounts all of the existing accounts in the Bank
